title: 'Worth buying best quality in less budget'
body: 'The pencils are very smooth and vibrant. Build quality is also very good however it is hard to blend these(if you know Technics it can blend easily) overall good product for beginners because it is in budget.'

title: 'The point keeps breaking with slight pressure'
body: 'The colors are very brittle. Even with slight pressure the nib or point breaks. It is a complete waste of money. Never expected this from a brand like Faber castle.'

title: '✨Nice pigmented colour pencils✨'
body: 🍄 bright 🍄 Soft 🍄 Pigmented 🍄 various colour options 🍄 blends well 🍄 affordable 🍄 Good enough for beginners 🍄 Lead doesn't break while writing 🍄 pink and red could be little brighter 🍄 overall rating 8/10

title: 'Delivered product Box and the colours are damaged'
'Superb'
body: 'My daughter liked this very much'

title: Faber-Castell's 48 Triangular Colour Pencils are a creative delight
body: 'The ergonomic triangular design offers comfortable grip and control reducing hand fatigue during long sessions. The vibrant pigments provide smooth and even color application suitable for various art projects. The break-resistant leads ensure durability. However the color range might lack certain shades. The included tin case offers convenient storage and organization. An excellent choice for artists of all levels these pencils elevate artistic expression and make coloring an enjoyable experience.'

title: 'Lovable Colours'
body: 'Today I got it. Nice product 👌 👍 👏'

title: 'Pros and cons'
body: Pros : 1. Best at this price 2. Blends well 3. Smooth 4. Dark and vibrant shades 5. So many shades  Cons : 1. Hard to blends (but if you're able to find the method to blend it then it'll blend smoothly) 2. Don't sharp to much bcz it'll break the leads ( soft tips) 3. So many useless shades ( more than 10+ shades are useless) 4. Idk the lead type I guess it's classics so it doesn't work with other brands colors like if your black or white color finished then you need to buy the original spare bcz this is not gonna with other's colour.

title: 'Good but Overpriced and poorly packed.'
body: 'A bit pricey! Pencils are quite good but it should be around 200-250/- for the pack. The pack of the product (not the parcel) is very poor. After removing all the pencils it takes a lot of effort to put them inside the box and the quality of the box is also very cheap.'

title: 'Pencil tips were broken for few of the pencils'
body: 'I did a replacement of this product but the second time also the pencil tips were broken. Now my kids is not allowing me to replace again as he wants to use them so we are sharpening the pencils and using them. I am yet to use the pencils but from the looks the pencils look good. If you are looking to buy this product dont show it to your kid until you receive a good product with the tips intact.'

title: 'Good with lot of improvement areas.'
body: I was not happy with the packaging at all. The package could include a two- wholed sharper and an eraser which I think Fabercastle did provide earlier. Also, I find the colour pencils too bright which makes me doubt it it's really a Fabercastle product.

title: 'Received damaged product with torn cover and broken lead'
body: 'Received damaged product with torn cover and broken lead. The product looked like very old and used by someone else. The experience was like buying a resale product.'

title: 'Horrible packaging'
